title: High quality care and welcoming GP practice
body: Thorough and quick diagnosis, treatment and communication. I have been a patient here for over 30 years. Every clinician is whole-heartedly dedicated to the most effective treatment. Knowledge of local and national services is unsurpassable. The advice never leaves you in any doubt, and if you have a niggling question, they will find the time to call you back.  The admin and support team work seamlessly and with a smile.

title: Efficient and friendly
body: I went to a flu vaccine clinic - I was expecting to have to queue as there were a lot of people walking towards the doors but I was straight in and out, no hanging around and the doctor had injected me before I even knew it. Very quick and efficient, very impressed. Never had any issues with this surgery, always get seen to or called back promptly. Very happy with the service they provide

title: Great practice
body: Very nice people with a very good service. Caring people. They made me feel less scared of the injection. This is the first practice I go to without fear or worry.

title: Awesome
body: After months of wanting to see a GP but being denied by old surgery I decided to move to spectrum health after hearing them on the radio and reading Leicestershire Live articles. I called for an appointment and was booked a call back with an advance practitioner. She called me on time and afer discussing my back probs she asked me to come into the surgery later to see a doctor. I was seen quickly, and the receptionist is amazing as well as I forgot my mask and she came to the door and passed me a mask free of charge. The manager was by reception when I was leaving and she asked me how my experience had been, which was fantastic. Very professional and patient focussed. Calm and lovely environment. Thanks for looking out for me

title: Totally reassured
body: I went for a CT scan today at 13.50. All the staff from the lady at reception ( who really helped and advised me) the wonderful professionals  that preformed my scan ( who kept me calm and distracted  me) to the nurse that removed my cannula were amazing. Friendly, funny and totally reassuring. These amazing people don't get the credit they deserve. I want to say thank you to them all.  Sadly due to being anxious I can't remember their names. This is why I want to do this review because often we forget names when we are stressed but we don't forget the amazing treatment we recieved.

title: Thank you for the care
body: Thank you to the GPs and especially to the Elderly Care Team for all their care and support of Mum and of our family in Mumâ€™s final weeks, it was greatly appreciated at a very difficult time.

title: Brilliant Surgery
body: I have been a patient at this practice for many years and I can say with honesty that every member of staff here do a fantastic job. It is an efficiently run practice and the GPâ€™s are second to none. Thank you for your care and support, it is greatly appreciated.

title: hardworking GP practice
body: Having called my practice with a medical enquiry I was extremely happy to have be advised that my gp would call be back later that day.  He did so, my prescription was sent electronically to a local pharmacy  (i am staying away from my usually address due to the pandemic)  I was unaware my GP could do that !  Very happy with service, good staff , cheerful GP>

title: Reception very poor, hygiene poor
body: The receptionist 1015 am 04/12/2020 was more interested in nattering on the phone, than deal with patients queuing up. The Taxi phone was NOT sanitised after each use by patients...patients were incorrectly directed to the wrong areas....the toilets were used by walk in pedestrians ( should have a lock with the key loaned to patients on request , toilets not cleaned after each use, disappointing

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: Rude
body: I have been a patient at this surgery for nearly 20 years. My experiences have for the most part have been not great. Some have been OK but I have never had an overly pleasant or warm experience. The people who answer the phone are generally unpleasant and short with you. I've always been made to feel as though I'm wasting the doctors' time. As a result I have done my best over the years to avoid any interaction. I only see a Dr when I feel its absolutely necessary and usually if it's concerning my children. I spoke to an angry-sounding receptionist to reluctantly book a phone appointment for myself today. I am still reeling from the way he spoke to me during the phone call appointment. I had to stop and take a breath to let it sink in. He was incredibly rude for no reason, and several hours later I keep replaying the conversation in my mind wondering what possible reason there could be for it. There wasn't one. I don't understand what motivation there could be for a doctor speaking to a patient like that.

title: Very eficent
body: Helped me out when I was very poorly and even the fact I was there a few times over the months they got my diagnosis right and got me to a near full recovery.Had time for me and always kept in contact and update me.Great doctors who look after you.

title: No compassion
body: It is appalling that young people who are pregnant and distressed cannot be accompanied to appointments by family, I understand we are in a pandemic but the rules don't make sense this is causing more emotional damage to them than doing good in reducing coronavirus. The staff don't show any compassion just robotically repeat the stupid rules without considering individual cases. It's really sad because I am also an NHS nurse and am ashamed at our policies and procedures. Please maternity services review your policies before young people are more traumatised by the lack of support you allow.

title: Great practice
body: Very good compared to others. My experience at my previous surgery was awful. I am happy with this surgery.

title: This great member of staff
body:
I have never put a review down on the behalf of my relatives on this surgery , so bare in mind this has take me a long time , but every time i have called surgery the receptionist few are absolutely rude , some have a language barrier extremely and this makes it even much worse due to going around in circles .
This particular day was about my prescription , hospital discharge and a referral 
I spoke to a lady explaining many time till i started getting very fraustrated  and asked to speak to someone else such a big Laungage barrier , she then transfered my call to another lady british spoken so easy to understand me , literally explained to her and within mins this was resolved , i asked the staff name , she was absolutely lovely she apologised which wasnt even her fault , all i will be saying this surgery im particular is lucky to have this member of staff i said to her i will be sending her a box of chocs but she is going on leave so when she returns in a week i will show her how much she is appreciated

title: Great Service
body: My appointment was arranged easily and quickly.  The doctor was very thorough, kind and knowledgeable.  I ended up feeling reassured and looked after

title: Too many mistakes
body: I have been with this practice since 1972. It has really gone down hill since getter too big. I have had many reasons to complain over the last few years. The latest reason was, I was given an appointment at Crook Log for a blood pressure check. I received a call changing the time to earlier as the nurse was leaving early! I clarified it was still at Crook Clog. When I arrived I was told the appointment was at Thanet Road. I refuse to go to Thanet Road anymore  as the last time I was there I was nearly hit by the door which was opened by the receptionist by button for another patient, this was whilst I was talking to the receptionist. Just jumped aside in time. Was told I shouldn't have been standing where I was. Think she needed glasses. I am now 77 and expect better care. And don't get me started on the e-form. After requesting some steroids in lower amounts twice in person. I now get a text asking me to fill in an e-form. I could go on but I'm even bored with it.

title: Fantastic Surgery
body:
Registered my elderly mum recently following a move to Leeds. 
She has been shown more care in her brief time there than in her whole time at previous surgery. 
Staff respond to emails, Doctors phone you! Receptionists are helpful! They even coordinate appointments to prevent multiple trips back and forwards. As a carer itâ€™s taken a lot of stress about managing mums conditions, and even coordinate patient transport for hospital appointments. Discussion with the doc doesnâ€™t feel rushed and we have been listened to. 
Itâ€™s a revelation. 
Iâ€™m considering moving practice myself.  
Thank you the Oakwood Team

title: Helpful and kind practice
body: As a patient for over 10 years I and my children have always been well looked after by the staff. They provide a great standard of care and always give time to listen properly to the issues. The recent covid measures are very well thought out.

title: Mixed Feelings
body:
I have always found the reception team to be as polite and helpful as they can, provided you treat them politely yourself.
Routine appointments are definitely few and far between, and the new triage system is... An experience. You are at the mercy of whichever doctor is on triage, and can be left without help if you aren't very good at communicating your issues. Routine appointment times tend to be about 2 weeks for telephone, or 3-4 for face-to-face (pre-pandemic). 
I have found the nurses have always been absolutely fantastic, caring and helpful, as well as professional and quick with routine things like blood tests. 
My experience with the doctors has been both good and bad at times, I find generally there is a strong focus on treatment rather than diagnosis, which can be hurtful rather than helpful at times. However, I have a suspicion that this issue may be more of a national problem rather than this particular surgery's. Some doctors here have better "bedside manner" (or chair side, I suppose!) than others, which can have a considerable effect if you need to talk about particularly personal issues.
I have found that they have coped well with the pandemic without the quality of care getting worse, which is impressive.

title: Fabulous Flu Vaccine Clinic
body: I was invited to the flu clinic today, very professionally and safely run!  Well done Smallfield and thank you ðŸ˜Š

title: 5 stars all round
body: Super efficient flu jab experience. Running on time, socially distance, reassuring information. Friendly staff. Well done to everyone involved keeping us safe at this difficult time.

title: Great practice with friendly staff
body:
Have been with this practice for a while now and they have been really helpful. Always get prompt good service. 
Recently had an mmr vaccine which they prompted me to have!

title: Great family practice
body: Have been a patient here for 20 years and have always had excellent care from the team. Friendly professional service. Recent outdoor flu clinics really well organised and effective.

title: A very good practice.
body: They are always kind and efficient and make every effort to ensure that you receive the best possible care.

title: Absolute Disgrace diabolical service
body: Please take heed and do not use these if you require test results before flying. we followed all of their instructions and did not receive our results in time for a 9am flight. well they did send them at 3am but we had four hour drive to the airport and missed out on an overnight stay and car parking all resulted in us loosing our holiday. no communication no phone lines available to speak to anyone absolutely disgraceful.

title: Great practice and team
body:
Had my flu jab what a fantastic speedy service in and out in seconds 
Well done to team Springfield 
Always there to help.

title: Repeat prescriptions deployable
body:
Yet another repeat prescription with item/s missing.
This time Carbamazepine tablets to control my epilepsy.
What do I have to do to get my medication?
If I now have a seizure, will the surgery take responsibility for any injuries I incur?
I doubt it.
Derek Kain

title: Flu clinic
body: Iâ€™ve worked in the NH S fir 40 years. We could learn a lot from Kildonan House flu clinic. Efficient yet personalised and friendly. Their set up was incredible. All rooms staffed with a nurse and an admin on computer so no botttkeneck. Absolutely superb. In the front door out the back in no time. Never experienced something quite so effective. Well done

title: excellent practice
body:
I was impressed with my whole  experience, well organised and professional at all times.
my prescription  records was brought up to date also whilst I attended my appointment

title: Great treatment
body: Iâ€™ve just been released from rde after 16 nights with the dreaded Virus I started in Hd unit I was lucky not everyone was Icannot praise the doctors and nurses enough they never stop helping patients unbelievable work also I found the food and the people serving very cheerful good food tea coffee always plentiful   Again Thank You all very much great team

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Great Service
body:
I had a full knee replacement, via nerve blockers and sedation. Two night stay. 
Wonderful staff, who fully supported and informed me , every step of the way. 
Clean room.
Staff very attentive to covid rules, masks , hand washing etc.

title: What a Joke!
body: Referred to this facility by my optician.  You will be seen in 4 weeks she said (4 being the magic number here).  Really impressed to get a courtesy call from spamedica the following day informing me I would get an appointment in 4 weeks.  4 weeks passed so I rang them, oh you're not on the system yet, give it 4 weeks.  Another 4 weeks passed and the same happened again.  I turned to the optician for help.  They rang on my behalf and guess what the magic 4 weeks were quoted again.  Well I'm still waiting!!   No wonder their waiting lists are short I'm still waiting to be "put on the system".   Had I gone to my local hospital I would at least be on a list and not just floating somewhere.  Spamedica are a JOKE!  The visiting date above is ficticious.

title: Great practice
body: Appointment was easy to make in line. Reception was efficient and appointment on time. Nurse had a nice manner.

title: Efficient, professional & friendly â€˜flu jabâ€™â€¦
body:
I really do not think the staff at Posterngate surgery could have set up the flu jab process any more efficiently - well done to you all. We arrived at the surgery, mask on, 5 minutes before our allotted time, met at the main
entrance for a temperature check, then straight through for names to be logged at reception, directly clearly for the next stage and shown through for our jabs.....vaccination process was quick but not rushed and we had time to ask questions, leaving through a different door reduced the chances of bumping into anyone else and we were back in our car by 8.37 a minute before we were actually due to have our jabs. 
Well done to all at the surgery for setting up such an efficient, effective and safe process we were really impressed.......keep up the great work it is really appreciated

title: Great welcome and efficient service
body: My husband and I attended for our flu jab this morning 5th December. Wow, it was so well organised and fast but you were made to feel very welcome and the staff were amazing. In and out in no time but not rushed and everything was explained.

title: Wonderful and helpful GP practice
body: I donâ€™t often leave reviews (positive or negative) but given my experience at Crawford Avenue Surgery, I wanted to share my positive experience. The practice reception staff were pleasant, accommodating and generally very helpful. I had some blood tests done which was also an amazingly positive experience. Usually, I find I have multiple jabs to get the required blood samples but this was a simple one prick to fill a few vials. Overall staff attitude was helpful and very pleasant. I would have no hesitation in recommending this practice to anyone - it has restored my faith in GP/primary care services. Well done to all at Crawford Street Surgery!

title: Very efficient and safe
body: Attended for a MMR vaccination. The process was very quick and I was in and out within about 5 minutes. A very high level of Covid infection control was being adhered to. Temperature taken on entry, everyone wearing masks, individual pens used and kept and a one way system. Very enjoyable visit.

title: great practice
body: Attended the surgery for some blood tests, was seen to within 3mins -great service. would highly recommend this practice. Thank you.

title: MMR vaccine
body: The whole journey was very efficient. I received a text message to reply if I wanted to have an appointment. I was then sent a text message with the date and time. On arrival the whole process was very efficient.

title: Day Surgery Unit
body: My son had a dental operation at the Day Surgery Unit. From start to finish, the experience was exemplary. The staff were all amazing with him and we felt totally at ease and supported throughout the day. Thank you so much to all the team who looked after him.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Cataract operation
body:
My cataract operation went very smoothly.
The SpaMedica staff from the receptionist to the surgeon were excellent.

title: Out standing
body: Excellent service given to me by reception and doctor, I would recommend this surgery to anyone for itâ€™s quick response and care of patients

title: Fantastic service and very kind, reassuring team
body: The whole process from appointment booking to reception welcome, clinic, scan and after-scan discussion was straightforward and smooth running. Every member of the team was friendly and welcoming (in spite of taking time from their Saturdays to work). The consultant put me at ease immediately and could not have been more kind and helpful. Great service. Many thanks and keep up the good work.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Fast and Effective Service
body: I took my son to the A&E Royal Manchester Children's Hospital, on 30th November 2020 for an very bad Allergy reactions, from using Carex antibacterial hand wash. From the moment we walked in, we were amazed on how caring and quickly my son was seen to. From the moment of registration of the illness, then seeing a Triage Nurse, then the Paediatric Doctor and pharmacy for prescription. It took us 25 minutes in total! I couldn't believe my eyes. I thank all 5 staffs at the Royal Manchester children's hospital for their professionalism and quick services. My son and I truly appreciate your services.

title: Fantastic service
body: I would like to say thank to to Park House for always providing a great service. My 7 year old daughter had an episode of facial cellulitis recently which needed urgent attention. The reception team were amazing and arranged for her to be seen as an emergency even though they were stretched to the limit with normal cases as well as being in the middle of a global pandemic. The treatment of my 2 children has always been exceptional here, there is always a clinician able to either offer advice or see them face to face. I am always very pleased with the service here. Thank you!

title: Very professional practice.
body: Thank you for all the great work you do .This practice has always been very professional.The empathy, and the people skills have grown with the training that all concerned have had!Keep up this excellent experience that this practice has become.

title: Very helpful
body: I sent in some blood pressure reading via email and received a call 2 days later and they were very polite and professional helpful

title: Amazing care
body: I arrived at A and E with covid restrictions. Everyone was polite and friendly and I was seen within an hour by triage and given medication and crutches within a few hours after visiting X ray who again we're caring and friendly.  The doctor I was seen by was phenomenal and gave me explanations and made sure I understood what was wrong and what to expect next. My adult son had to take me as I couldn't walk without help and he understandably could not go in with me. I was worried he was getting cold outside as we do not have transport for him to go and sit in and security had already found somewhere in the warm for him to safely go as she noticed he was getting cold. A big, big thank you to them as it was a cold night.

title: Great experience
body: I was impressed with the organisation and friendliness of the staff when I came for my flu vaccination. Excellent Covid safe practices in place. I will be very happy to attend here for my Covid19 vaccination.

title: Great practice
body: I have always had good support from this practice. I started with Flu jabs this year which was all very efficiently organised.

title: Brilliant patient care
body: From the minute you arrive the staff are polite and caring, everything regarding your treatment is explained clearly. Excellent covid procedures in place so you feel safe. Felt like I was a private patient and not at an NHS hospital.

title: Flu Jab
body: Efficient, friendly service from GP administering flu vaccine. Good communications via text messages.

title: Excellent GP and helpful, friendly staff
body: My GP at Plumstead Health Centre always makes time for me and listens to what I have to say.  She is extremely kind and provides expert care. I couldnâ€™t ask for a better GP.  The staff are all friendly and helpful too.

title: Great Service and Speedy Response
body:
I would just like to say how impressed I was recently with the entire Dermatology process during the COVID crisis. I phoned my doctor regarding a mole on my back, due to family history I was given a link to send photos to a mobile phone app. These were assessed and a consultant phoned me and asked me to come to the clinic. This was only 2 days later on a Saturday morning. I work for the FCO and was due to fly on the Wednesday morning. I had to cancel my flight as the consultant stated the mole needed to come off and a lymph node scanning . 
On the Monday morning a telephonist offered me a cancellation slot for the Tuesday afternoon which I accepted. I had two moles removed, the consultant used dissolving stitches as I work in Mogadishu and would have issues getting the stitches taken out. 
The following Friday I received an appointment for the lymph node ultrasound which I attended and was informed everything was okay and I had no issues to worry about!

I am amazed at the speed of the whole process; especially during the COVID pandemic and the wanted to express my gratitude to all concerned for their dedication and friendly and efficient manner. 

All we usually hear is how bad something is within the NHS, and you never get much positive feedback, so I felt compelled to write and express my thanks to all concerned.

Regards

John Crouch

title: Dermatologist
body: Was seen on time, staff really good. Treatment is working really well. Would recommend this to anyone.

title: Handy practice
body: Theyâ€™ve been very attentive and helpful. Long waiting times on the phone for appointments but that just means a lot of people like it. Some process to improve waiting times will help immensely

title: Excellent Gp practice
body:
Attended for a vaccination , organisation very good and COVID safe
Always received good care for myself and my family from the practice

title: Lovely staff
body:
I had to visit A and E today , I had a fairly bad water infection . Thereâ€™s always a nag in your mind ,should I be here ,am I an emergency etc . 
The staff are so lovely ,make you feel special ,ease your concerns and done in such a serene and unhurried way . 
I also frequent Urology and the same applies here .
I think we are lucky to have such a good hospital ,Iâ€™ve heard lots of horror stories about others . 
Well done Salisbury

title: Super efficient
body: Organised, informative, super quick and made to feel at ease. Felt safe and spacious. No concerns whatsoever

title: Fab practice
body: Had my 1st flu jab this morning and was very impressed how smoothly it all went..."like a well oiled machine". If this is how easy the flu jab is given out,  roll on the covid-19 vaccination....thank you all at the clinic...your time is much appreciated. Have been a patient at clinic all 59yrs of my life. Stay safe!!!!

title: A Big Thank You.
body:
Am not sure where the staff were based, but A big thank you to the staff who attended Spa Hill today.
My wife had a suspected epileptic fit earlier today.
You are all stars.

title: Real improvement with telephone system
body:
I often phone the surgery and have in the past have had to try a few times.
The new telephone system is excellent.
I was answered straight away with a message telling me what number I was in the queue and how long I may have to wait.
Well done and thanks to all of you for your help.
Keep safe.

title: Professional flu jab service
body: Fast throughout of clients during the session, covering a large number with courtesy and professionalism.

title: Flu vaccination
body: I attended the surgery for my flu jab.  Appointment was easy to arrange, the surgery appeared well set up and organised (ready for a lot of people) and the staff were all very pleasant and helpful.

title: Fantastic doctor surgery
body: Been a member of this surgery for 35 plus years. Always had such amazing service and support. Highly recommend. The doctors are fantastic and all the have been utterly amazing during the COVID crisis and ensuring the practice is extremely safe and still running and available to all. THANK YOU to all staff.

title: no service at all
body:
Impossible to get an appointment
they never pick up the phone and after being calling from 8 to 9 u decide to go there, they tell u that they r fully book.
U can´t explain more than one thing to them at once, u must get another appointment.

title: Very organised
body: I donâ€™t often need primary care support, so my main contact has been around vaccinations and they have been amazing. Good communication through texts, and good time-keeping. Keep up the good work!

title: Great practice
body:
Easy to get appointments 
Staffs are very friendly and supportive would surely recommend this practice

title: Detailed care
body:
I have visited this hospital many times as part of ongoing treatment and care. Throughout the year, my treatment has been exemplary. 
I cannot thank enough each and every member of staff that I have come across during my visits.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Friendly practice
body: We went for our flu jab today very efficient and the Dr was really great and made us feel very much at ease. All the staff were lovely and friendly on a very busy day for them.

title: Flu vaccine
body: Nurse who did vaccine was so lovely.Very polite and friendly.Very quick too.Didâ€™nt have to wait long from start to finish.

title: Fantastic hospital
body: A very friendly and professional hospital. Informed every step of the way on treatment. On release given paperwork and Information for recovery. I cant praise all at Tetbury Hospital highly enough. Many thanks.

title: fantastic team
body:
I had an ablation at wythenshawe and I would like to thank all the people on WARD F2 and the theatre team, I was very anxious and the team on the ward were fantastic, the operation was a success and because of the great team they relaxed me and made sure I was ok. when I got back to recovery they again did everything to make me comfortable. I cant thank you enough  !!!
thank you all cant thank you  enough..

title: Excellent
body: From scan to consultant, fast and efficient .Many thanks to all staff and a particular mention to my doctor.

title: Amazing and Caring Service
body: I'm extremely thankful to the staff at Foundation House for all of the help over the past weeks. I was at rock bottom when I entered the service, so even the tiniest setback could bring me down, yet the team were always helpful, attentive and caring, and more importantly, working hard to get me the care I need. I know it's not an easy job, and I know the NHS is under a lot of strain during the COVID crisis, so I'm eternally grateful for all the help and attention I've been provided.

readBy.name: Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

title: Good practice
body: I had routine blood test. I was informed that a urine test had been requested but no one was able to tell me why. My regular doctor was unavailable to ask. However I accessed my patient record and saw it was with reference to a previous kidney stone from 3 years ago.  I am now waiting for a container on order to facilitate the test. The practice appears to be very well organised, with strict COVID 19 precautions being observed

title: Really Well Organised Flu Jab Session
body:
As above.
Well organised from appointment communication to execution of jab
COVID protocols world class.
Reassuring health professional.
Demonstrated care and commitment to patient.
Felt safe and secure.

title: Amazing team and delivery suite.
body: I came in for an induction and from start to finish I couldn't of asked to be in better hands. The midwifes and staff are so amazing. So lovely, so kind and just made my whole experience that I was dreading just exceed my expectations. They were so young but the best midwives ever throughout my labour and I couldn't of wished for it to go any better. So grateful to have met the lovely staff here.

title: Efficient & responsive care!!
body:
During these unprecedented Covid times, it is amazing to receive such efficient & responsive care from the Bailey Practice!! Our daughter had an allergic reaction of some kind & on phoning the practice (At 8.30am) we were asked to email a photo showing her symptoms and told to expect a phone consultation between 9 & 1.00pm. 
At 8.55 we received a call from the doctor. After careful questions we were encouraged to come in (within the hour) so our daughter could be seen in person. She was given a thorough check with clear advice & we left feeling amazed at how quick and responsive the Bailey practice had been. We feel very lucky with the level of care we receive from this small, (therefore personal) inclusive practice. We are always able to get appointments, repeat prescriptions and responsive and speedy advice, which sadly isnâ€™t the picture I hear about many other local GP surgeries. 

A big thank you to all the staff at the Baileys surgery, youâ€™re doing a fantastic job!!!

title: What a difference!
body:
Fortunately I have not been an overly frequent visitor to what was known as callowland surgery.
Today I had my flu jab, so was pleasantly surprised to see firstly the refurbishment and secondly to experience a swift process.
Years of huge waiting times had conditioned me to expect anything up to an hours wait. But no, fab welcome, filled a form while queuing and a jab.
Excellent experience

title: Excellent patient service
body:
Both myself and my husband have needed care in this last year and weâ€™ve both received an excellent service from IG medical
Everyone in primary care is under so much pressure but weâ€™ve been dealt with professionally and respectfully every time by all members of the team and promptly too. The new online services are so helpful especially in busy working lives as ours are and the flu clinic was done with military precision. Thankyou.

title: Great Practice
body: Just had a flu jab, brilliant service from appointment to vaccination, efficient and friendly service. Very happy ðŸ˜ƒ

title: Great practice
body: I have always received the very best of care from Bearwood Medical Centre and it continues, I had my first flu jab yesterday, the receptionist I booked with was so friendly, I've always found receptionists at this practice very friendly and helpful. The organisation for the jab in such difficult times was implemented so well, from the guy who was welcoming us in and making sure we were socially distanced, the young lady wearing a Christmas hat who directed us to the surgery, to the nurse who administered the jab ( didn't feel a thing). They all gave up their Saturday for us and I'm very grateful. Thanks for the great job you do!!

title: Great practice. Super efficient and caring.
body: Great practice. Super efficient. Quick and painless and effective treatment. Strongly recommend. Well organised .

title: Good practice
body: Very impressed with receptionist, a young man who was very helpful sorting out my next two blood test appointments on the day I needed them

title: Excellent
body:
Very efficient service.
Flu jab for me and husband completed within a couple mins. When covid jabs is available this is likely to be a great location and staff to have.

title: So efficient
body: Received a letter regarding flu vaccinations for over 50s. Logged on to Patient Access, got my â€˜slotâ€™ for Saturday morning. Such an efficient way to vaccinate many people who may not otherwise bother to organise it. I queued for a couple of minutes, entered the car park entrance, where all the doctors were ready in doorways to administer vaccine and then out the main entrance. Felt very safe. I hope the Covid vaccines are organised in this way. Would never fail to recommend this practice.

title: So well organised
body: Just been in for flu jab and MMR vaccines. In and out in 5 minutes and so well organised. Gives me complete confidence as we move towards the Covid-19 vaccination.

title: Flu Vaccination
body:
Excellent efficiency and cleanliness.  Hands cleaned temperature taken join queue of 2 . Jab given. In and out in 5 minutes.  
Brilliant

title: Great practice
body: Felt very special and was cared for with care and arrention. The surgical procedure was carried out with efficiency as was post operative care.

title: Exceptional.
body: Exceptional service. The organisation and staff were wonderful. From my appointment at the opticians for an eye test to having my cataract removed was just 7 weeks. Well done Spa Medica. Will definitely recommend the clinic.

title: Flu vaccine 55 plus
body:
Went 10 - 15 minutes early. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Very small queue. Very efficient process. 
Hopefully will experience similar process for any other vaccine.

title: Amazing service
body: I had MOHS surgery on a BCC on my right temple. Everyone from reception staff to nurses and of course my consultant were so kind and attentive. I would have no hesitation in recommending The Westboune to family and friends. It has only been 5 weeks since my surgery and the area is healed and scar is fading every day.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Fantastic surgery
body: Had flu jab today and whole process was seamless. All staff and doctors polite and go out of their way to help with queries.

title: Good Doctors
body: Was called in for my first flu vaccination. All efficiently booked and administered. Friendly doctors. Would recommend.

title: Great service friendly welcoming staff
body: Had the flu Jab today. ( didnâ€™t hurt ). Greeted by lovely staff.   Was only there 5 minutes.  All done and dusted quickly and efficiently.   Thank you.  Surgery was so clean and fresh.

title: Very special care and attention.
body:
Itâ€™s such a shame weâ€™re not able to name names in this review, because there are 2 very special nurses that looked after me on the HDU throughout the night and day of December 1st and 2nd.
Following my operation, these brilliant nurses were so caring.
I felt safe and they were so reassuring. Thank you so much.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: FLU/PNEUMONIA vaccine programme
body: Brilliantly organised vaccine programme this autumn 2020. Teenage son was called up for pneumonia jab (following getting his flu jab) given underlying health conditions. Also excellent communication from GP given sonâ€™s underlying conditions throughout shielding periods etc in 2020

title: Under pressure
body: I have been at this surgery for awhile, I know things donâ€™t run perfectly however the receptionists are brilliant. I feel as though they always want to do their best even under pressure

title: Let down
body: I have always praised this practice, however today I felt so let down. Dr should have rung me at 5pm, call came early from unknown number, so not answered. Called reception and advised due to my condition I didnâ€™t answer. The lady advised me that the doctor would call me back . From 5pm (when the call should have come) I sat waiting. By 8.30pm I gave up hope. I had got myself ready mentally for the call and arranged for my kids to be out so I could speak freely. No call. I am now left with my illness over the weekend . No doubt they will say itâ€™s my fault
